Yes, I'm doing well, how about you?
It sounded like you were very stressed out about this essay you're writing, so of course I will help you!
I found a rather interesting article explaining why producers in Brandenburg still put on Shakespeare's plays.
Since it's in German, I will sum it up for you and attach the link below!
The article was written by Karim Saab in 2016 and published in the rather serious newspaper MÃ¤rkische Allgemeine Zeitung, it's called Darum spielen wir Shakespeare.
The article deals with the question of why Shakespeare is still the most popular playwright of all time and interviewed some theatremakers in Brandenburg to answer.
The first one states that modern invention and society have not managed to dissolve human exmotion and the other interviewees seem to agree.
They all claim that Shakespeare has a unique way of sharing these emotions and depicting humanity at its worst and best in a way no one else could.
The second interviewee is convinced that there is always something new to discover about Shakespeare and that it helps us understand the past but confronts us with thuuues of the present.
Another interviewee adds that without Shakespeare we would not even have other famous poets like Schiller, Goethe and more.

He also comments on the variety of things that are portrayed in these works, such as women in power, people grasping for happiness and more, which Shakespeare portrayed in an incredibly complex and unique way.

The next interviewee thinks in a similar way and points out Shakespeare's rhetorical and stylistic power and how Shakespeare touched people with his art in ways no one else could because he appealed at all of hteir emotions with his words.
The last interviewee also states that the cueruht of works and the amount of languages they have been translated to make it almost impossible to get past Shakespeare.
He thinks that the playwright is not just timeless but also includes thoughts that are very interesting and appealing to us nowadays.
So as you can see, there are many reasons to portray Shakespeare's work, not just in general, but also in Germany specifically.
I hope I was able to help you along and, if that's alright with you, I would love to read your essay when it's finished!
